body: thanks, I'll take a look again.

Through the blog, I learned how to go from MySQL Server to OpenTelemetry Collector, but I am confused about how to go from OpenTelemetry Collector to SkyWalking OpenCensus Receiver, and I don't know much about SkyWalking OpenCensus Receiver,  Are OpenCensus Receiver and Opentelemetry Receiver (https://skywalking. apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/setup/backend/opentelemetry-receiver/) the same?

Yes, Opentelemetry collector has OC exporter for it. 
Take a look at k8s e2e settings. It guides you how it works.
OK, I will take a look.
This PR is ready for review :)
No title.

So set the exporters of the OpenTelemetry Collector to OTLP gRPC and set the port to 11800, the data will flow to the SkyWalking OpenCensus Receiver, and then I just need to write the yaml.
Is the idea right?
Yes, you are correct.
I can't reproduce this error. CI and my local compiling are both passed.
I'm trying to configure yaml, but I'm running into a problem: how can I see the final data in oap?
What do you mean? The data would be persistent in the database.

I get it.
I forget the database and trying to see from the UI before.

I configure the setting of the `opentelemetry-collector` to print metric data in the console, The form of the data is similar to the following:
``` 
Metric #16
Descriptor:
     -> Name: mysql.threads
     -> Description: The state of MySQL threads.
     -> Unit: 1
     -> DataType: Sum
     -> IsMonotonic: false
     -> AggregationTemporality: AGGREGATION_TEMPORALITY_CUMULATIVE
NumberDataPoints #0
Data point attributes:
     -> kind: STRING(cached)
StartTimestamp: 2022-07-28 01:09:58.7576015 +0000 UTC
Timestamp: 2022-07-28 02:57:07.0609427 +0000 UTC
Value: 0
```
The format provided to me by `MAL doc` is as follows:
```
instance_trace_count{region="us-west",az="az-1"} 100 
```
Maybe the data format will change by the `SkyWalking OpenCensus Receiver`.
But I am confused about when I configure the `metricsRules` by MAL what will the names of these Metrics(such as the `instance_trace_count` of above) I need to call?
OK, I will see it.

This is not using ID=0 to initial, we expect ID=0 to report the trace. We have to pick one, otherwise, the trace would be reported repeatedly or face race conditions.

My question would be, why don't you have a ID=0 worker?

> This is not using ID=0 to initial, we expect ID=0 to report the trace. We have to pick one, otherwise, the trace would be reported repeatedly or face race conditions.
> 
> My question would be, why don't you have a ID=0 worker?


Thank you for your reply !
I read the report process  flow , and I think init work happends there.
[https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong/blob/master/kong/plugins/skywalking/handler.lua#L44](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong/blob/master/kong/plugins/skywalking/handler.lua#L44)
```
    if config.sample_ratio == 100 or math.random() * 100 < config.sample_ratio then
        kong.ctx.plugin.skywalking_sample = true

        if not client:isInitialized() then
            local metadata_buffer = ngx.shared.tracing_buffer
            metadata_buffer:set('serviceName', config.service_name)
            metadata_buffer:set('serviceInstanceName', config.service_instance_name)
            metadata_buffer:set('includeHostInEntrySpan', config.include_host_in_entry_span)

            client:startBackendTimer(config.backend_http_uri)
        end

        tracer:start(self:get_remote_peer(ngx.ctx.balancer_data))
    end
```

And when first worker(I think it is randomly) reach here, it will do initial work including call client:startBackendTimer.
But in client:startBackendTimer function
[https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/lib/skywalking/client.lua#L33](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/lib/skywalking/client.lua#L33)
```
function Client:startBackendTimer(backend_http_uri)
    initialized = true
```
The first thing the function do is set initialized = true.
So other worker will not enter Client:startBackendTimer function , including work-id = 0.

First of all, you should know, all codes have be included and tested through e2e
1. Nginx LUA proj, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/.github/workflows/e2e.yaml
2. Kong proj, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong/blob/master/.github/workflows/e2e.yml

We really run the plugin in the service, and verified the segments it reported. 

I am not the one writing all these codes, but I think it is better if you could find out what is the difference between your case and our e2e tests.

I don't think the whole code flow has issues in a general way, otherwise, ppl would report this a long time ago.
I think some settings and special use cases/versions, or something, make things different.

> First of all, you should know, all codes have be included and tested through e2e
> 
> 1. Nginx LUA proj, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/.github/workflows/e2e.yaml
> 2. Kong proj, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-kong/blob/master/.github/workflows/e2e.yml
> 
> We really run the plugin in the service, and verified the segments it reported.
> 
> I am not the one writing all these codes, but I think it is better if you could find out what is the difference between your case and our e2e tests.

Yes I konw, I read test file before to find some information .  I notice  the test conf has do some init work in nginx.conf, including call startBackendTimer function.
[https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/test/e2e/nginx/conf.d/nginx.conf#L44](https://github.com/apache/skywalking-nginx-lua/blob/master/test/e2e/nginx/conf.d/nginx.conf#L44)
```
 init_worker_by_lua_block {
        local metadata_buffer = ngx.shared.tracing_buffer

        metadata_buffer:set("serviceName", "skywalking-nginx")
        -- Instance means the number of Nginx deployment, does not mean the worker instances
        metadata_buffer:set("serviceInstanceName", "e2e")
         -- set ignoreSuffix
        require("skywalking.util").set_ignore_suffix(".jpg,.jpeg,.js,.css,.png,.bmp,.gif,.ico,.mp3,.mp4,.svg")

        require("skywalking.util").set_randomseed()
        require("skywalking.client"):startBackendTimer("http://172.16.238.10:12800")

        -- If there is a bug of this `tablepool` implementation, we can
        -- disable it in this way
        -- require("skywalking.util").disable_tablepool()

        skywalking_tracer = require("skywalking.tracer")
    }
```
I think this is why test case can pass? Just my guess.
Yes, it is needed as documented.

I have a general understanding of `MAL`, and I successfully persisted a part of data to the database.
And I am comfused about the expSuffix, such as the `vm.yaml`：
```
expSuffix: service(['node_identifier_host_name'] , Layer.OS_LINUX)
```
I can understand that the `layer` I should set to `MYSQL` in the future, but how do I understand `service` above?
Is it the entity type of the setting when I new a dashboard, and what should I configure it to be?

**expSuffix** means the suffix of all following expresses. This part is going to execute after all following MAL settings.

Here, in the MAL doc, we should find `service`, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/mal/#metric-level-function.

Right now, you have metrics, you need to use this function or other to determine, which entity are these metrics belonging. 

A new layer(MYSQL) should be added, then you could config a new dashboard for this entity. Don't worry about the menu, we need some codes changes to support this new layer, as I mentioned in the beginning.

I get it ,I missed this part of the doc at the time.
Now what should I do? Maybe the step 4?
You could send a pull request to add Layer to the codes. Then step <4>
OK, I will try to do it.
I saw that there is a `DATABASE` layer in the Layer enum. Does it conflict with the `MYSQL` layer?

> I saw that there is a `DATABASE` layer in the Layer enum. Does it conflict with the `MYSQL` layer?

No, doesn't
I get it.
Yes, `VIRTUAL_CACHE` makes sense, please submit a pull request with screenshots(before/after) to verify the topology is back to normal.
After reading the commit history of Layer.java, I found that I only need to modify this file (Layer.java) to add the MYSQL layer, without changing any other files or documents?
Yes, that is correct.
OK, I have sent the PR, https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9407

Thank you for your edit, I'm always not rigorous enough. I will do better next time.
Now we should do the step <4>?
Yes, let's move on step 4.
How can I help with this part？

What do you mean? Step 4 means you review the otel metrics, and summary a list of metrics meaningfully.
You could refer examples from Gafana/Prometheus or MySQL examples of other APM tools.
OK, I understand!

>what's community's plan for BanyanDB to adopt a fault-tolerant, multi-replicas structure (using Raft or other algorithms). 

Relevant feats are under discussion. 

> 1. If BanyanDB pod fails (network partition, worker node down), do we have to restart and wait for it to recover, or have other failovers like activating a slave backup?

BanyanDB will know nodes' roles. The operator doesn't take care of recovery. Restarting the pod is acceptable. 


> 2. If users changes BanyanDB version and its docker image, can we rolling update BanyanDB while still providing normal service? Does BanyanDB support hot-update for its start-up configurations?

The rolling update is a complicated topic. We don't have any discussions in the community. The operator could leave it as is now and refine the CRD once it's on our radar.
No, there is no such thing.
Oracle is commercial prod, it is out of open source hands.

I'm running into a problem. The metric is following:
```
Metric #4
Descriptor:
     -> Name: mysql.buffer_pool.pages
     -> Description: The number of pages in the InnoDB buffer pool.
     -> Unit: 1
     -> DataType: Sum
     -> IsMonotonic: false
     -> AggregationTemporality: AGGREGATION_TEMPORALITY_CUMULATIVE
NumberDataPoints #0
Data point attributes:
     -> kind: STRING(free)
StartTimestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:05.723937 +0000 UTC
Timestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:15.7352765 +0000 UTC
Value: 4161
NumberDataPoints #1
Data point attributes:
     -> kind: STRING(misc)
StartTimestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:05.723937 +0000 UTC
Timestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:15.7352765 +0000 UTC
Value: 27
NumberDataPoints #2
Data point attributes:
     -> kind: STRING(data)
StartTimestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:05.723937 +0000 UTC
Timestamp: 2022-07-29 16:08:15.7352765 +0000 UTC
Value: 4004
```
I want to calculate  `(1 - free pages) / total pages`. So I write the exp `100 - mysql_buffer_pool_pages.tagEqual('kind','free') * 100 / mysql_buffer_pool_pages.sum([])`

This exp can not save any data to database, but use `mysql_buffer_pool_pages.tagEqual('kind','free')`  and `mysql_buffer_pool_pages.sum([])` alone will save the data successfully.

I don't know why it will happen, maybe I can not use a data twice in one exp?
@wankai123 ☝️

In my mind `mysql_buffer_pool_pages.sum([])` would make all labels disappear, how could you create an entity from this MAL exp? SampleFamily is calculated when labels are matched. 

You could re-read this part of doc, https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/concepts-and-designs/mal/#binary-operators

Thank you, I understand where I am wrong.
And I change the exp to `100 - mysql_buffer_pool_pages.tagEqual('kind','free').sum([]) * 100 / mysql_buffer_pool_pages.sum([])`
It works successfully now.
It works, but logically you can't build an legal entity accordingly. So, label should include the server name/IP to list on service list on the dashboard.
I get it, I will change it later.
We're evaluating APMs at the moment. You don't support Open Telemetry, so you're out of the running. Is your protocol so much better you can ignore it?
You could skip the project, if it doesn't fit your requirements. Nothing more.

I am trying to set up the dashboard. Does he have docs? I only find this one(https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/main/latest/en/ui/readme/#custom-dashboard) and it cannot give me enough help.

Also, I think I have some problem with my understanding of Entity type. 
What is the meaning of those enum of Entity type?  And what will I set to the dashboard?

```
service([svc_label1, svc_label2...], Layer) extracts service level labels from the array argument, extracts layer from Layer argument.
```
I also can not understand the first parameter in `service` function in `MAL` . What is the meaning of `service level labels`?

That is because you don't have enough understanding about the hierarchy of how we visualize data.
Try to think in this way
1. We would list service on the dashboard as the first page in menu. How does this list come from if you only use MAL?
2. Metrics have to bind with an entity, service, instance,or endpoint. Then you have to generate one of these according to you metrics labels.

That is why you need to provide label(s) for service function to generate an entity.

Docs actually are helping a little but not much for visualization. The examples are. All the dashboards you can see are good examples to show you the features of today's UI.
 
Usually, service list, aka mysql server list comes first. Then you could dive into one service dashboard with more metrics.

> I also can not understand the first parameter in service function in MAL . What is the meaning of service level labels?

Specifically, you need labels value to indicate which service(mysql server) metric you are generating.
Thank you, I will try it again.
@StreamLang Are you going to submit a pull request to fix this?

> @StreamLang Are you going to submit a pull request to fix this?
yes , PR will be submitted today

Please update changes.md in the PR template. You missed one step.
And remove <> around the issue number.
General good. wait for polish.

> Please update changes.md in the PR template. You missed one step. And remove <> around the issue number.

please check again.
You could create APIs fot native logging/tracing integration, and provide a shell on the APIs for tokio tracing. This would be helpful to set up APIs boundaries.
Hello, could you tell me how to solve this problem
Can't you simply read the milestone of PR? https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/9300. Why you put comments everywhere.

I'm wondering how the `skywalking UI` finds the service.
I set up a `Service List widget` but has nothing in it.

It loads data from service_traffic index through GraphQL API,
https://github.com/apache/skywalking-query-protocol/blob/master/metadata-v2.graphqls#L119


You could check the query with parameters from Browser logs.
I get it.

The service function you asked about in previous discussion would create this metadata.
But you need to make sure the label of name and layer are correct and match your dashboard entity level.

That's right.
It works successfully after I fix a typo.
@mrproliu Please check this PR. We would need profiling(record data type) to support this kind of merging to reduce ElasticSearch load.
I think we should file an issue about optimizing TTL mechanism for this change?

> I think we should file an issue about optimizing TTL mechanism for this change?

yes, we should optimize TTL mechanism, I'll draft one later.

> We're evaluating APMs at the moment. You don't support Open Telemetry, so you're out of the running. Is your protocol so much better you can ignore it?

Who are u?

@mrproliu I added a `ebpf_profiling_schedule_id` column  in `EBPFProfilingScheduleRecord`. Because when merging all metrics in one index, the `id` will rewrite to `modelName_id` to avoid conflict.

please check.

I have configured yaml and set up the dashboard, although I feel that some settings are not very good.
So, what should I do next?

What do you mean? Which parts are not good?

You could write a long comment here to list all metrics with explanation(what are these metrics for).

When I wrote the doc, I found that there are some metrics mysqlreceiver (https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-collector-contrib/tree/main/receiver/mysqlreceiver) not provided, I plan to use prometheus mysqld exporter to add, is this ok?
Yes, sure. Which one could provide more metrics and more clear, it is better.
I get it, I will adjust the metric I designed.
Please sync and resolve conflicts.

I finished the doc.

https://github.com/apache/skywalking-java/tree/main/test/plugin/scenarios/jdk-threadpool-scenario

@yswdqz I need you to grant `comment` access to me.
OK, I have granted.
When you are ready, please list the all indices now. I am thinking we should list them in some docs, as from now, our index list is nearly unchanged.
Could you send a pull request to specify the changes?

The docker compose is meant to be used after a local build. If you wan to use it with latest released Docker images, you should export the two env vars before running docker-compose up, not modifying the .env file

After disabling logic sharding in ES, we have these indices:
* sw_ui_template
* sw_metrics-all-`${day-format}`
* sw_log-`${day-format}`
* sw_segment-`${day-format}`
* sw_browser_error_log-`${day-format}`
* sw_zipkin_span-`${day-format}`
* sw_records-all-`${day-format}`
Please update `backend-storage.md` add some description below `Since 9.2.0` paragraph

Hello, this design doc looks great basically! Especially Part 1, 2, 3, and 5 is helpful for the end-users. As the first bunch of metrics, I think it's enough and then we could listen to the community's voice to expand them. 
BTW, ShardingSphere acts as a DB server and also has [some metrics](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/master/shardingsphere-agent/shardingsphere-agent-plugins/shardingsphere-agent-plugin-metrics/shardingsphere-agent-metrics-prometheus/src/main/resources/prometheus/metrics.yaml) for your reference.
Look forward to this task!
I get it , Thank you for your help !

> I get it , Thank you for your help !

Notice, if you want to continue on new things, ShardingSphere is one another point, after we have MySQL and PostgreSQL server monitoring :)
Of course, another thing is adding MySQL server to our showcase.
I see. I'm resetting the dashboard. After this, I will add the showcase.
Don't hurry. Dashboard review would take time. After the dashboard is ready, docs are updated, then we move on showcase repository.
OK.
